definitions: additional material added at the end of a book or document
examples: The contract included an important addendum about payment terms
Please review the addendum before signing the agreement

definitions: small poisonous snake with zigzag pattern found in Europe
examples: The hiker spotted an adder basking on the warm rocks
An adder bite requires immediate medical attention

definitions: person who cannot stop using harmful substances or engaging in behaviors
examples: The former addict now counsels others struggling with dependency
Many addicts need professional help to overcome their habits

definitions: chemical substance added to improve or preserve something
examples: Food manufacturers list all additives on product labels
This paint contains no harmful additives or chemicals

definitions: person to whom mail or communication is addressed
examples: The addressee refused to accept the registered letter
Please verify the addressee details before sending the package

definitions: muscle that pulls body parts toward the center or midline
examples: The athlete strained his adductor muscle during the sprint
Hip adductors help bring your legs together when walking

definitions: person who is very skilled or proficient at something
examples: She became an adept at solving complex mathematical problems
The young adept impressed everyone with his martial arts skills

definitions: state of being enough or good enough for a particular purpose
examples: The inspector questioned the adequacy of the safety measures
We need to assess the adequacy of current funding levels

definitions: act of following or keeping to a rule, belief, or instruction
examples: Strict adherence to safety protocols prevents workplace accidents
The doctor emphasized adherence to the prescribed medication schedule

definitions: person who supports a particular party, person, or set of ideas
examples: The political adherent campaigned tirelessly for her candidate
Many adherents gathered to hear the philosopher speak

definitions: process of sticking or being stuck to a surface or object
examples: Poor adhesion caused the paint to peel off the walls
The surgeon carefully separated the tissue adhesion during the procedure

definitions: substance used for sticking objects or materials together
examples: Apply the adhesive evenly before joining the two surfaces
This strong adhesive works well on both wood and metal

definitions: goodbye said when parting for a long time or forever
examples: With a tearful adieu, she boarded the ship for America
He bid his adieu to the company after thirty years

definitions: condition of being next to or adjoining something else
examples: The adjacency of the two properties made the merger logical
Urban planners consider adjacency when designing public spaces

definitions: word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun
examples: The adjective 'beautiful' describes how the sunset looked
Students learned to identify every adjective in the sentence

definitions: act of temporarily stopping a meeting or legal proceeding
examples: The judge called for an adjournment until the following morning
After the adjournment, committee members discussed the issues informally

definitions: formal judgment or decision about a problem or disputed matter
examples: The case went to adjudication after negotiations failed completely
The board's adjudication resolved the long-standing property dispute

definitions: person who makes formal judgments about problems or disagreements
examples: The adjudicator carefully reviewed all evidence before deciding
An independent adjudicator will resolve the contract dispute fairly

definitions: thing added or attached as supplementary rather than essential
examples: The university hired several adjunct professors for specialized courses
The garden serves as a pleasant adjunct to the main building

definitions: person who investigates and settles insurance claims
examples: The insurance adjuster inspected the damage from the storm
An experienced adjuster can quickly evaluate legitimate claims

definitions: highest ranking naval officer who commands fleets or naval operations
examples: The admiral ordered the fleet to set sail at dawn
She became the first female admiral in the nation's history

definitions: government department or officials managing naval affairs
examples: The admiralty issued new regulations for merchant vessels
Historical documents from the admiralty revealed strategic naval plans

definitions: feeling of respect and warm approval for someone or something
examples: Her dedication to teaching earned widespread admiration from colleagues
He expressed his admiration for the artist's innovative technique

definitions: person who regards someone or something with respect or approval
examples: The young admirer waited patiently for an autograph
Secret admirers often send anonymous flowers or gifts

definitions: quality of being acceptable or valid, especially as legal evidence
examples: The lawyer questioned the admissibility of the witness testimony
Courts must determine the admissibility of digital evidence carefully

definitions: process or fact of entering or being allowed to enter
examples: Security guards control admittance to the exclusive event
The sign clearly stated no admittance without proper identification

definitions: something mixed with something else, typically as minor ingredient
examples: The concrete contains an admixture to improve its strength
An admixture of different cultures enriched the neighborhood's character

definitions: firm warning or reprimand about behavior or actions
examples: The teacher's admonition about cheating was taken seriously
Despite repeated admonitions, he continued to arrive late

definitions: unnecessary activity or ceremony about something unimportant
examples: Without further ado, let me introduce our guest speaker
They made much ado about the minor scheduling change

definitions: sun-dried brick made from clay and straw mixture
examples: The old mission was constructed entirely from adobe bricks
Adobe houses stay cool in desert climates naturally

definitions: transitional period between childhood and adulthood, typically ages thirteen to nineteen
examples: During adolescence, teenagers experience significant physical and emotional changes
Her adolescence was marked by rebellion and self-discovery

definitions: person who legally takes another's child as their own
examples: The adopter provided a loving home for the orphaned child
Prospective adopters must undergo thorough background checks first

definitions: deep love and respect, often with religious worship overtones
examples: The child gazed at her mother with pure adoration
His adoration for classical music began in childhood

definitions: decoration or ornament that makes something more attractive
examples: The bride wore simple adornments of pearls and lace
Ancient tombs contained gold adornments and precious stones

definitions: hormone released during stress that increases heart rate and energy
examples: The adrenaline rush made her heart pound during the race
Extreme sports trigger massive adrenaline release in the body

definitions: excessive admiration or praise, often beyond what is deserved
examples: The celebrity grew tired of constant adulation from fans
Critics warned against the adulation of political leaders

definitions: process of making something poorer by adding inferior substances
examples: Food inspectors test for adulteration of olive oil
The adulteration of medicines poses serious health risks

definitions: voluntary sexual intercourse between married person and someone other than spouse
examples: The divorce proceedings cited adultery as the primary cause
Many religions consider adultery a serious moral transgression

definitions: period in life after physical and mental maturity is reached
examples: The transition to adulthood brings new responsibilities and freedoms
In adulthood, she pursued dreams abandoned in youth

definitions: process of promoting or moving forward in position or development
examples: Her advancement in the company came through hard work
Technological advancement continues to transform modern society rapidly

definitions: arrival of a notable person, thing, or event
examples: The advent of smartphones changed communication forever
Many traditions celebrate the advent of spring with festivals

definitions: person who seeks exciting and dangerous experiences or travels
examples: The adventurer mapped uncharted territories in the Amazon
Young adventurers often seek thrills in extreme sports

definitions: word that modifies verbs, adjectives, or other adverbs
examples: The adverb 'quickly' tells how she ran the race
Students identified each adverb in the paragraph

definitions: word or phrase functioning as an adverb in sentences
examples: The adverbial phrase 'with great care' modified the verb
Teachers explained how adverbial clauses enhance sentence meaning

definitions: person or group that opposes or attacks another
examples: The chess master studied his adversary's previous games carefully
Former adversaries became allies against the common threat

definitions: difficult or unpleasant situation marked by misfortune or suffering
examples: She showed remarkable strength when facing adversity
The community came together during times of adversity

definitions: public notice or announcement promoting a product or service
examples: The television advert featured a catchy jingle
Companies spend millions creating memorable adverts for audiences

definitions: person or company that creates and pays for advertisements
examples: The advertiser targeted young adults with social media campaigns
Major advertisers sponsor popular television programs regularly

definitions: person who gives advice or guidance in specific area
examples: The financial advisor recommended diversifying her investment portfolio
Students meet with academic advisors to plan their courses
